sn5.8:1.2: Then, in the morning, the bhikkhunī Sīsupacālā dressed …
sn5.8:1.3: she sat down at the foot of a tree for the day’s abiding.
sn5.8:1.4: Then Māra the Evil One approached the bhikkhunī Sīsupacālā and said to her:
sn5.8:1.5: “Whose creed do you approve of, bhikkhunī?”
sn5.8:1.6: “I don’t approve of anyone’s creed, friend. ”
sn5.8:2.1: “Under whom have you shaved your head?
sn5.8:2.2: You do appear to be an ascetic,
sn5.8:2.3: Yet you don’t approve of any creed,
sn5.8:2.4: So why wander as if bewildered?”
sn5.8:3.3: I don’t approve of their teachings;
sn5.8:3.4: They are not skilled in the Dhamma.
sn5.8:4.1: “But there’s one born in the Sakyan clan,
sn5.8:4.2: The Enlightened One, without an equal,
sn5.8:5.2: The One with Vision who sees all.
sn5.8:5.3: “Attained to the end of all kamma,
sn5.8:5.4: Liberated in the extinction of acquisitions,
sn5.8:5.5: That Blessed One is my Teacher:
sn5.8:5.6: His is the teaching I approve. ”
sn5.8:6.1: Then Māra the Evil One, realizing, “The bhikkhunī Sīsupacālā knows me, ” sad and disappointed, disappeared right there.
